main event: A civilian observed a spherical object, possibly a weather balloon, over Paget, Bermuda on June 20, 1949.
interesting points: The object was brilliantly silver and initially appeared as medium-sized star in the sky., It was first sighted at about 45-50 degrees off the horizon and traveled due south., The object's size seemed to increase slightly as it moved south and disappeared straight upward., The sighting lasted approximately 5-10 minutes., The conclusion pointed to the object being a weather balloon released by the 8/9 Weather Squadron Detachment at 1800 on the day of the sighting.
sighted object: spherical object, possibly a weather balloon
